A simpler way to factor 12x^2 - 5x  - 2 would be to multiply the coefficient of the first term by the third term and then continuing to factor that equation. 

x^2 - 5x - 24 = 0
(x-8)(x+3) = 0
 Now you bring back the original coefficient and try to factor something out
(12x-8)(12x+3)
4(3x-2)3(4x+1) this is equivalent to just (3x-2)(4x+1) = 0

Ta Da!
